str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From kata and echo; to hold down, in various applications.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From ek; the exterior; figuratively aside from, besides.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
Without a cause, purpose; purposelessly, in vain, for nothing. Probably from eiko; idly, i.e. Without reason.
